Newton's Method is Newton's Method August 21, 2019 There are two versions of Newton's method, one for root-finding, $f(x) = 0$, and one for optimization, $min_{x \in \R^n} f(x)$. In this post, I show explicitly that Newton's method for optimization is simply Newton's method applied to finding fixed points of the gradient map $x \mapsto \nabla x f$.
